meanings.definition: To find fault or criticize in a petty way.
meanings.sent1: She nitpicked every little detail of the project, making it hard for others to feel appreciated.
meanings.sent2: He always nitpicked his sister's drawings, never acknowledging her effort.
meanings.sent3: The teacher nitpicked the students' essays, but they all ended up looking the same.
meanings.sent4: Her constant nitpicking was like a magnifying glass, making even the tiniest mistakes seem huge.
meanings.sent5: The way she nitpicked at his appearance left him feeling small and unimportant.

meanings.definition: To be overly critical or meticulous in pointing out minor flaws.
meanings.sent1: The manager nitpicked every report that came across his desk, causing delays in the workflow.
meanings.sent2: She nitpicked the decorations for the party, ensuring everything was perfect.
meanings.sent3: His friends teased him for nitpicking the movie plot, but he couldn't help himself.
meanings.sent4: The chef nitpicked the presentation of the dish, turning it into a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The detective's nitpicking attention to detail helped solve the case.
